commands.explanation: Disabling window animations makes your device feel significantly faster by removing the visual delay when opening or closing applications. This can reduce perceived lag and improve battery life.
commands.name: Window Animation Scale

commands.description: Controls animation when switching between apps
commands.explanation: Transition animations occur when switching between different apps. Disabling these results in instant transitions, making multitasking feel much snappier.
commands.name: Transition Animation Scale

commands.description: Controls how long animations play before transitioning
commands.explanation: This setting governs the duration of all system animations. Setting it to 0 eliminates animation delays entirely, providing the most responsive experience.
commands.name: Animator Duration Scale

categories.description: Adjust or disable system animations for faster UI response and reduced battery consumption
categories.name: Animation Settings

commands.description: Clear app caches to free up storage and improve performance
commands.explanation: Clearing app caches removes temporary files that can accumulate over time. This frees up storage space and can help apps run more smoothly. The command attempts to free 128GB, effectively clearing all caches.
commands.name: Trim All Caches

categories.description: Manage and terminate background processes to free up RAM and CPU resources
categories.name: Kill Background Apps

commands.description: Enable sustained high performance (may cause heating)
commands.explanation: Fixed performance mode clocks the CPU and GPU with upper and lower bounds, disabling thermal throttling. This provides maximum performance for demanding tasks but may cause the device to heat up and drain battery faster. Use with caution.
commands.name: Fixed Performance Mode

categories.description: Lock CPU and GPU to maximum performance, disabling thermal throttling
categories.name: Fixed Performance Mode

commands.description: Disable compressed RAM (may improve performance on some devices)
commands.explanation: ZRAM creates virtual RAM by compressing memory. While it can help with multitasking, it uses CPU cycles for compression/decompression. Disabling it may improve performance on devices with sufficient physical RAM.
commands.name: ZRAM (Virtual RAM)

commands.explanation: RAM expansion uses storage as virtual memory. While it helps keep more apps in memory, it's slower than physical RAM and can reduce storage lifespan. Disabling it may improve overall system responsiveness.
commands.name: RAM Expansion

categories.description: Disable virtual RAM expansion to improve performance and save battery
categories.name: Disable RAM Plus

commands.explanation: Higher refresh rates (90Hz, 120Hz) provide smoother scrolling and animations but consume more battery. Lowering to 60Hz can significantly extend battery life on devices with high refresh rate displays.
commands.name: Peak Refresh Rate

commands.explanation: Setting a minimum refresh rate keeps the display at a constant rate. Lower minimum rates allow the system to reduce refresh rate when static content is displayed, saving battery.
commands.name: Minimum Refresh Rate

commands.description: Disable blur effects on windows and backgrounds
commands.explanation: Window blur effects require GPU processing. Disabling them reduces GPU load, potentially improving performance and battery life, especially on mid-range devices.
commands.name: Window Blur Effects

commands.description: Reduce transparency effects for better performance
commands.explanation: Transparency effects require additional rendering. Reducing transparency can improve performance, especially on devices with limited GPU capabilities.
commands.name: Reduce Transparency

categories.description: Adjust screen refresh rate, window blur, and transparency for better performance
categories.name: Refresh Rate & Display

commands.explanation: Disables Rakuten phone service which may slow down app launches on devices with this service installed.
commands.name: Rakuten Denwa Service

commands.explanation: Prevents the system from automatically sending security reports, reducing background activity during app launches.
commands.name: Security Reports

commands.explanation: Disables automatic error reporting which can slow down app startup, especially when apps crash or encounter errors.
commands.name: App Error Reporting

commands.explanation: Disables logging of app activity starts, reducing overhead during app launches.
commands.name: Activity Start Logging

categories.description: Optimize app startup process for faster launch times
categories.name: Speed Up App Launch

commands.explanation: Samsung's Game SDK can throttle CPU/GPU performance. Disabling it may improve gaming performance but could cause overheating.
commands.name: Game SDK

commands.explanation: Disables the Game Launcher home feature, reducing background processes related to gaming.
commands.name: Game Home

commands.explanation: Prevents Bixby from activating during gaming sessions, avoiding interruptions.
commands.name: Game Bixby Block

commands.description: Disable automatic temperature-based throttling in games
commands.explanation: Disables automatic thermal throttling during gaming. May improve performance but monitor device temperature.
commands.name: Game Auto Temperature Control

categories.description: Disable Samsung's Game Optimizing Service that may throttle performance
categories.name: Game Optimization (Samsung)

commands.explanation: K2HD (K2 High Definition) enhances audio quality by upsampling and improving sound clarity. May slightly increase CPU usage.
commands.name: K2HD Audio Effect

commands.explanation: Tube amp effect simulates analog tube amplifier sound characteristics, adding warmth to audio output.
commands.name: Tube Amp Effect

categories.description: Enable advanced audio processing for better sound quality
categories.name: Audio Quality Enhancement

commands.description: Reduce long-press delay for faster response
commands.explanation: Reduces the time required to register a long press, making the touchscreen feel more responsive. Lower values mean faster recognition.
commands.name: Long Press Timeout

commands.explanation: Reduces the timeout for detecting multiple presses (like double-tap), improving responsiveness.
commands.name: Multi-Press Timeout

commands.explanation: Reduces the minimum time a tap must be held to register, making touches feel more immediate.
commands.name: Tap Duration Threshold

commands.explanation: Reduces the period during which touches are blocked after certain events, improving touch responsiveness.
commands.name: Touch Blocking Period

categories.description: Reduce touch latency and improve touchscreen responsiveness
categories.name: Touchscreen Response

commands.explanation: Forces the system to use OpenGL for rendering, which may improve graphics performance on some devices.
commands.name: Force OpenGL

commands.explanation: Forces GPU-based vertical sync, which can reduce screen tearing but may slightly increase latency.
commands.name: GPU VSync

commands.explanation: Enables multicore packet scheduling for better network performance on multi-core processors.
commands.name: Multicore Packet Scheduler

commands.explanation: Allows the CPU to spike to peak speed without sacrificing optimized mode. Samsung-specific feature.
commands.name: Enhanced CPU Responsiveness

categories.description: Various system-level optimizations for CPU, GPU, and overall performance
categories.name: System Optimization

commands.disable_cmd: shell settings put global private_dns_mode off
commands.enable_cmd: shell settings put global private_dns_mode hostname
commands.explanation: Private DNS encrypts DNS queries for enhanced privacy and security. May slightly impact connection speed.
commands.name: Private DNS Mode

commands.description: Use AdGuard DNS for ad blocking
commands.enable_cmd: shell settings put global private_dns_specifier dns.adguard.com
commands.explanation: Configures AdGuard DNS which blocks ads and trackers at the DNS level, improving privacy and potentially reducing data usage.
commands.name: AdGuard DNS

categories.description: Configure private DNS for enhanced privacy and security
categories.name: Private DNS

commands.explanation: Disabling WiFi power save mode keeps WiFi at full power, improving connection stability and speed at the cost of battery life.
commands.name: WiFi Power Save

commands.description: Enable cellular data on device boot
commands.explanation: Automatically enables cellular data when the device boots, ensuring immediate connectivity.
commands.name: Cellular on Boot

commands.description: Keep mobile data always active (even on WiFi)
commands.explanation: Keeps mobile data active even when connected to WiFi for faster switching. Increases battery usage.
commands.name: Mobile Data Always On

commands.explanation: Hardware offload improves tethering performance by using dedicated hardware instead of CPU.
commands.name: Tether Offload

commands.explanation: Disabling constant BLE scanning reduces battery drain and CPU usage from background Bluetooth activity.
commands.name: BLE Scan Always Enabled

commands.explanation: Disables the network quality scoring interface, reducing background network analysis.
commands.name: Network Scoring UI

commands.explanation: Prevents the system from automatically recommending networks, reducing background scanning.
commands.name: Network Recommendations

categories.description: Optimize network settings to reduce background scanning and improve connectivity
categories.name: Network Performance

commands.explanation: Intelligent sleep mode uses sensors to detect if you're looking at the screen. Disabling it saves CPU cycles but screen may turn off while you're reading.
commands.name: Intelligent Sleep Mode

commands.explanation: Adaptive sleep keeps the screen on while you're looking at it. Disabling it may save battery but requires manual screen timeout management.
commands.name: Adaptive Sleep

commands.description: Enable app restriction for background activity
commands.disable_cmd: shell settings put global app_restriction_enabled false
commands.enable_cmd: shell settings put global app_restriction_enabled true
commands.explanation: Restricts background activity of apps to save battery and improve performance.
commands.name: App Restrictions

commands.explanation: Prevents the system from automatically enabling power save mode at low battery levels.
commands.name: Automatic Power Save

commands.explanation: Adaptive battery learns your usage patterns to optimize battery life. Disabling it gives you more control but may reduce battery efficiency.
commands.name: Adaptive Battery Management

categories.description: Configure power-saving features and battery optimization settings
categories.name: Power Management
